page.title: 17FAMILY LIFE IN 1985
page.content: In 1985 family life is very different from family life say a hundred years ago .The average family nowadays has a television and in the majority of families that television is coloured.Most families also have a car. It is most unusual for someone not to have a telephone. A very high percentage of people in Britain own their own home.Others rent them from the council or private business's but very few are actually homeless Food is nearly always obtainable. There are no droughts or famines and no family could really said to be starving as in other countries. There is a great deal of inequality in Britain in 1985 though.Some people are with well paid, important jobs have much more money than they need.They spend great amounts of money on thingswhich are far from necessary
